trial_identification.studytitle: A placebo controlled clinical trial on the efficacy of atorvastatin 20 mg daily in patients with bronchial hyper-responsiveness.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A placebo controlled clinical trial on the efficacy of atorvastatin 20 mg daily administration for 4-6 weeks in patients with bronchial hyper-responsiveness.

interventions.interventions: Atorvastatin 20mg once daily will be administered orally for 4-6 weeks to all patients in the intervention group according to the clinician's discretion.
interventions.comparator: Identical placebo (sugar pills) made by the same manufacturer once daily for 4 - 6 weeks will be administered to all patients in the control group according to the clinician's discretion.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Decrease in hyperresponsiveness in methacoline challenge test at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks from the start of the treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Decrease in cough (questionnaire) at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks from the start of the treatment
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks from the start of the treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: serum IgE (lab test) at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks from the start of the treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks from the start of the treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: blood eosinophilia (lab test) at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks from the start of the treatment
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at Baseline and at 4-6 weeks from the start of the treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients present with cough for more than 6 weeks.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients who had contraindication for methacoline challenge test (according to American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society -ATS/ERS- guideline 2006)/ patient with previous diagnosis of asthma/patients who suffer heart failure/ obvious paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea (PND) or wheezing in physical exam.

trial_design.concealment: The treatment allocation was randomized by a researcher who is not directly involved in the trial. Central randomization by telephone.

fundingsource.fundingname: National Research Institute for Tuberculosis and Lung Diseases (NRITLD)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We could not find any study that has examined the use of atorvastatin in bronchial hyperresponsiveness . The proposed study will provide scientifically valid data to date on whether atorvastatin 20 mg is effective in bronchial hyperresponsiveness or not
